attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent I urge you to not increase the adoption-related fees that
families pay the USCIS to bring their children home to their Forever Families. With
Chinese adoptions anticipated to take as long as 3 years, families will not only
have to file their I600A once and be finger-printed, but may go through this
process as many as three times in order for their documents to not expire before
they have completed the adoption. Most families who adopt are not celebrities or
millionaires, they are middle and upper-middle class families. They are first-
responders like police officers and fire-fighters, they are teachers, small business
owners and regular people who go to work each day for someone else. People will
take out loans to help finance their adoptions, and doing so doesn't make them
less worthy of adopting - they simply want to parent a child that badly. Children
will be born regardless of whether or not people are available to adopt them. I urge
you to consider the larger impact a decision like this will have on our global
society, for its impact will stretch beyond the US borders. Please do not increase
your fees further.

Thank you for your consideration.
Margaret Kowal
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Margaret Kowal
